meanings.definition: Undermine the power and authority of (an established system or institution)
meanings.sent1: She subverts the rules by always finding loopholes.
meanings.sent2: The hacker subverts the security measures to gain unauthorized access.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student subverts the school's strict dress code with creative alterations.
meanings.sent4: His rebellious spirit subverts the traditional norms of society.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox subverts the traps set by the hunters with clever tactics.

meanings.definition: Intentionally disrupt or destroy the normal operation of (something)
meanings.sent1: The storm subverts the peaceful atmosphere of the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The virus subverts the computer system, causing it to crash.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy subverts the neat arrangement of the living room by scattering toys everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise subverts the tranquility of the library.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected plot twist subverts the audience's expectations in the movie.
